subject: Re: JUnit-JPA (Hibernate) - Spring - Struts2 testing howto
msgSnippet: Solution for this dependencies issue I described below: Right click on test class (or complete project), Run, Run configuration, Classpath, User entries,
messageBody:
Solution for this dependencies issue I described below:
Right click on test class (or complete project), Run, Run
configuration, Classpath, User entries, choose Maven dependencies -
choose Up, ie. put maven dependencies before project dependencies.
This solved problem, so I don't need to include persistence-api-
1.0.jar form target folder.

And again, can you help me about this, guys:
Is there any complete (even the simplest one) example showing how to
test JPA-Spring-Struts2? I don't believe that nobody wrote something
about this - at last all these technologies and combination of those
are mainstream - not some exotic combination.

I have problems with testing Struts2 actions (classes) with JUnit. Is
there any simple example wiring Struts2+Spring
(struts.xml+applicationContext.xml)?

Cheers,
Marko
